geninfo.para: The 8600 utilizes double-sided tape along the upper edge of the grille to prevent the grille from warping when exposed to high temperatures. The tape is applied in the assembly plant and fully cures in three days. Removal of the grille after the tape adhesive cures, without damaging the grille, can be difficult, particularly in cold weather. This TSI is being revised to update the size and configuration of the double-sided tape.

partsinfo.para: 3M Double Sided Tape #VHB 4956, 3/8" wide, International Part Number 3585047C1

warning.para: To prevent vehicle damage and personal injury, park the vehicle on a level surface, set the parking brake, chock the wheels, and turn the engine off.

step1.para: Place the vehicle in a warm environment. Heat helps to reduce the adhesion forces of the tape.
Remove the eight "star" fasteners from the grille. See Figure 1.

Open the hood and apply heat to underside of the hood for 3-4 minutes. Make certain that the heat is applied where the hood overlaps with the top of the grille. Too much heat will discolor the hood and/or grille. Keep the heat gun moving. See Figure 1 for approximate location of tape.
Close hood and position yourself in front of the hood facing the vehicle.

Firmly grasp the lower edge of the grille and pull outward/upward as if pivoting the grille about the upper edge where it meets the hood. Since the tape has such high retaining force, a minimum of two people lifting is recommended to maintain an even force across the bottom of the grille. Pull slowly!
Once the grille and hood have separated, clean the tape residue from the hood and grille using 3M Tape Removal Kit.
Cut one 41" piece of 3/8" wide 3M Double Sided Adhesive Tape.
Place the tape on the hood. The tape should be centered on the hood and placed one inch forward of the rear grille contour. See Figure 1.
Remove the paper backing from one side of the tape and place it on the hood. Firmly press on the backside of the tape to seat it against the surface of the hood.
Place the grille into position against the hood. Do not remove the protective paper from the second surface of the tape!

Make certain that the grille is in the proper position with mounting holes aligned and mark its location by placing masking tape on the hood and grille at several locations. Mark the tape so the grille can be precisely located once the adhesive tape is exposed.
Remove the protective paper from the second surface of the adhesive tape.

Carefully locate the grille slightly above its proper location on the hood and lower it slowly into position against the hood. Make certain that the locating marks previously made on the masking tape are in the proper location.
Press the grille down firmly against the hood. Apply approximately 20 pounds of force along the grille area above the tape.
